text: What’s going on with Zygote’s versioning at the minute? Looks like there’s been quite a lot of non-breaking commits since 0.6.0, and no 0.6.x versions tagged.

elements.text: What’s going on with Zygote’s versioning at the minute? Looks like there’s been quite a lot of non-breaking commits since 0.6.0, and no 0.6.x versions tagged.

text: Was wondering the same things. Has Zygote officially adopted a continuous delivery policy yet? Would be nice.

elements.text: Was wondering the same things. Has Zygote officially adopted a continuous delivery policy yet? Would be nice.

text: Not sure. I had certainly been practicing it with my commits :joy:

elements.text: Not sure. I had certainly been practicing it with my commits

text: In theory Zygote follows ColPrac, which does not require continuous delivery but does say some slightly weaker requirement, like "Release no breaking changes rapidly".

elements.text: In theory Zygote follows ColPrac, which does not require continuous delivery but does say some slightly weaker requirement, like "Release no breaking changes rapidly".

text: Don't you have the ability to tag releases Will?

elements.text: Don't you have the ability to tag releases Will?
